newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank, News Corp in talks with TV Asahi.
newsitem.headline: Softbank, News Corp in talks with TV Asahi.

text.p: Softbank Corp said on Friday that it and News Corp were continuing discussions with TV Asahi, their affiliate broadcasting company in Japan, about placing members on the broadcaster's board.
"We are carefully studying requests made by TV Asahi to see if we will accept them," said a Softbank spokesman. "We have made clear from the start that we are not interested in taking over TV Asahi."

Asahi National Broadcasting Co, known as TV Asahi, said on Thursday that it would not accept board members from Softbank and News Corp unless they confirm in a written statement that they would refrain from purchasing further shares of TV Asahi.
TV Asahi, citing requests from other big shareholders, also asked Softbank and News Corp to confirm that they would not be involved in management of the company.
The two firms recently acquired a 21.4 percent stake in TV Asahi through their joint venture Softbank News Corp Media, becoming the third largest shareholder.
The announcement surprised other shareholders, including Japan's biggest newspaper company, as the purchases were made through another company.
TV Asahi originally planned to accept two part-time board members from the two firms at a shareholders' meeting on November 7.
